intro: Oenothera ascendens, commonly known as the ascending evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its showy yellow flowers that bloom in the evening. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, often in rocky soils. Its stems are usually erect and branched, while its leaves are alternate and lance-shaped. Oenothera ascendens is known for its adaptability to harsh conditions and is often found in desert regions.
